idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

citeinfo.title: PA Fish Database Species Sample Points

idinfo.accconst: Of the 160 total species originally listed, 54 are proposed for listing as Threatened and/or Endangered, and have been removed from the Pennsylvania Fish Species Database
idinfo.useconst: For educational/demonstration purposes only. The Originator, Publisher and Distributor exclude any and all implied warranties and make no warranty or representation with respect to the data files or accompanying documentation, including quality, performance, merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose. These data files and documentation are provided 'as is' and the User assumes the entire risk as to their quality and performance. These data are not to be redistributed for commercial profit. Reproduction or redistribution of this digital data set without permission of the Originator/Publisher is expressly forbidden. The Originator and Publisher should be clearly cited in any product derived from this data. Any modifications to this data must be described in any digital or hardcopy product derived from this data.

cntperp.cntorg: The Pennsylvania Cooperative Fish and Wildlife Research Unit

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover: Fish Species Database data are contained within three files, which contain the following items: Pafish.dbf - AREA (n/a) PERIMETER (n/a) PAFISH (internal coverage cataloging number) PAFISH_ID (user defined identifier w/i coverage) SITES_ID (user defined site number) REGION (user defined regional category) NEW (regional item used to combine SITES_ID with REGION) REG10 (regional item used to combine SITES_ID with REGION) SITE_ID (user defined site number with regional description) Pafbcoccur.txt - GEAR (numeric code used to identify the type of collecting gear that was used during the original field work: 1=all gear 2=day electroboat 3=night electroboat 4=electrotowboat 5=electrobackpack 6=trap net PA 7=trap net CT 8=hoop net 9=D frame net 10=meter net 11=visual 12=seine 13=gill net experimental 6 14=gill net experimental 5 15=gill net floating 16=gill net standard mesh 17=trawl 18=trammel net 19=rod and reel 20=tournament 21=snorkel 22=SCUBA 23=chemical 24=day electroboat and electrotowboat 25=day electroboat and electrobackpack 44=electrotowboat 2 units 45=electrotowboat and electrobackpack 55=electrobackpack 2 units) SPECIES (three-digit code used to identify each fish species within the Database) SITE-ID (user defined site number with regional description). Speciesfile.txt - SPECIES (three-digit code used to identify each fish species within the Database) ALPHACODE (abbreviation assigned to some fish species) COMMON NAME (common name of each fish species within the Database) SCIENTIFIC NAME (scientific name of each fish species within the Database). The following species are listed as threatened or endangered and are not included in the PAFISH database: E=endangered, T=threatened, C=candidate, X=extirpated, UL=unlisted and D=delisted. Common name Scientific name Status Ohio lamprey Ichthyomyzon bdellium C northern brook lamprey, Icthyomyzon fossor E mountain brook lamprey Ichthyomyzon greeleyi T silver lamprey Ichthyomyzon unicuspis X least brook lamprey Lampetra aepyptra C American brook lamprey Lampetra appendix C shortnose sturgeon Acipenser brevirostrum E lake sturgeon Acipenser fulvescens E Atlantic sturgeon Acipenser oxyrhynchus E spotted gar Lepisosteus oculatus E longnose gar Lepisosteus osseus C bowfin** Amia calva C skipjack herring Alosa chrysochloris T hickory shad Alosa mediocris E goldeye Hiodon alosoides T mooneye Hiodon tergisus T cisco Coregonus artedi E central mudminnow Umbra limi C eastern mudminnow Umbra pygmaea C silver chub Macrhybopsis storeriana E gravel chub Erimystax x-punctatus E hornyhead chub Nocomis biguttatus C bridle shiner Notropis bifrenatus E river shiner Notropis blennius E ghost shiner Notropis buchanani E ironcolor shiner Notropis chaleybaeus E bigmouth shiner Notropis dorsalis T blackchin shiner Notropis heterodon E redfin shiner Lythrurus umbratilis E Southern redbelly dace Phoxinus erythrogaster T longnose sucker Catostomus catostomus E smallmouth buffalo Ictiobus bubalus T bigmouth buffalo Ictiobus cyprinellus E spotted sucker Minytrema melanops T river redhorse Moxostoma carinatum C black bullhead Ameirus melas E mountain madtom Noturus eleutherus E tadpole madtom Noturus gyrinus E brindled madtom Noturus miurus T northern madtom Noturus stigmosus E burbot Lota lota E brook silverside Labidesthes sicculus C threespine stickleback Gasterosteus aculeatus E brook stickleback Culaea inconstans C banded sunfish Enneacanthus obesus E warmouth Lepomis gulosus E longear sunfish Lepomis megalotis E Eastern sand darter Etheostoma pellucida E bluebreast darter Etheostoma camurum T Iowa darter Etheostoma exile E spotted darter Etheostoma maculatum T tippecanoe darter Etheostoma tippecanoe T channel darter Percina copelandi T gilt darter Percina evides T longhead darter Percina macrocephala T Potomac sculpin Cottus girardi D spoonhead sculpin Cottus ricei X deepwater sculpin Myoxocephalus thompsoni X ** regarding Bowfin - Inland populations only.
overview.eadetcit: For additional entity and attribute information, contact David Argent at (dga3@psu.edu).

attracc.attraccr: All attribute data (e.g. species, gear, scientific name) have been manually inspected for spatial and content (i.e. typos) accuracy. Inspections were performed by running the Fish Species Database and comparing results with the original fish records.

dataqual.logic: Each of the 10875 data entries are represented as individual points, and are therefore not subject to logical consistency errors such as overshoots, dangling nodes, duplicate arcs, etc. Coordinate accuracy was tested by manually verifying geo-referenced species occurrences.
dataqual.complete: The integrity of geo-referenced data within the Fish Species Database was verified by running the Database and comparing results with the original fish records. Note: When the Pennsylvania Fish Species Database is downloaded from the PASDA website, the links which connect the supporting text (i.e. tables) files to the ArcView shapefile will be lost. In order to use the Atlas, you must first re-establish the necessary links in your ArcView project. Pafish.shp (destination/active table) is linked (i.e. one-to-many relationship) to pafbcoccur.txt (source table) via "SITE_ID" (in pafish.dbf) and "SITE-ID" (pafbcoccur.txt). Pafbcoccur.txt is joined (i.e. many-to-one relationship) to speciesfile.txt via "SPECIES".

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy was dependant upon the level of detail included in the original fish records, and were tested by manually verifying geo-referenced species occurrences.

srcinfo.srccontr: The Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission conducts annual summer fish surveys on lakes, rivers, and streams throughout the state. The data presented here are based upon these annual surveying records. Because a single organization was responsible for the collection of all records within the Pennsylvania Fish Species Database, many inconsistencies in method and effort have been eliminated.

cntperp.cntorg: The Pennsylvania Cooperative Fish & Wildlife Research Unit

procstep.procdesc: All of the site locations examined by the Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission during their annual summer fish surveys were located on 7.5" USGS quads. The geographic coordinates (i.e. longitude & latitude) for each site were then used to generate a geo-referenced point in an ArcInfo coverage, with the necessary fish data being manually appended within the Tables module. Once all of the Fish and Boat Commission records had been entered, the coverage was converted to an ArcView shapefile, with the supporting files "Pafbcoccur.txt" and "Speciesfile.txt".

distinfo.distliab: The USER shall indemnify, save harmless, and, if requested, defend those parties involved with the development and distribution of this data, their officers, agents, and employees from and against any suits, claims, or actions for injury, death, or property damage arising out of the use of or any defect in the FILES or any accompanying documentation. Those parties involved with the development and distribution excluded any and all implied warranties, including warranties or merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose and makes no warranty or representation, either express or implied, with respect to the FILES or accompanying documentation, including its quality, performance, merchantability, or fitness for a particular purpose. The FILES and documentation are provided "as is" and the USER assumes the entire risk as to its quality and performance. Those parties involved with the development and distribution of this data will not be liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages arising out of the use or inability to use the FILES or any accompanying documentation.
